definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Then he turned a switch and the voices stopped.
sentences.chinese: 他於是關上電門，說話聲音就中斷了。

sentences.english: The master switch was fixed in grandpa's room.
sentences.chinese: 但是總電門是安在祖父的屋裏的。

sentences.english: turn off the switch when anything goes wrong with the machine.
sentences.chinese: 萬一機器發生什麼故障，就把電門關上。

sentences.english: Momentarily pressing the test switch initiates the self-test diagnostic routine.
sentences.chinese: 點觸式按壓測試電門可以啓動自檢診斷常規程序。

sentences.english: The aftermath of Cablegate led to the first publicly viewable infowar.
sentences.chinese: 密電門的餘波讓首次讓公衆一窺信息戰的真面目。

sentences.english: There was something wrong with the switch and I got a shock.
sentences.chinese: 電門有毛病，電了我一下。
